Title: Relates to the use of virtual credit cards by insurers and certain health care plans
Summary: Authorizes an insurer to pay a claim for reimbursement made by a provider using a credit card, virtual credit card or electronic funds transfer payment method that imposes on the provider a free or similar charge to process the payment; defines "virtual credit card" as a single-use series of numbers linked to a fixed dollar amount and provided by an insurer to a provider for the purpose of paying a claim for health care services performed by the provider; makes related provisions.
LawCode: Amd §§3217-b & 4325, add §4242, Ins L; amd §4406-c, Pub Health L
ActClause: AN ACT to amend the insurance law and the public health law, in relation to the use of virtual credit cards by insurers and certain health care plans
